sub_title: Building resilient economies with SecondMuse | Formerly at UNLEASH â€¢ Ogilvy â€¢ Sony Music
summary:
I am a multi-faceted social impact consultant with strong expertise in strategic program planning, project management, monitoring & evaluation, donor reporting, partnerships and have facilitated multiple online, physical and hybrid events with Liberating Structures. For the last 8 years, I have accumulated a breadth of experience working in the startup ecosystem, carbon accounting, the music, film and advertising industry. 

I believe that systems today perpetuate environmental destruction and social inequity and am working to transform them to be more inclusive and sustainable. Additionally, I believe that the power of awareness and our voice can be instrumental in behavioural change and that the value of People-first Public-Private-Partnerships (PfPPPs) as a means for ensuring sustainable, ethical and community-building economic development, can change the world. 

I am committed to creating solutions to benefit people and protect the planet.

In Operations, I support the writing of donor reports to Global Affairs Canada (one of our principal funders), design and run quarterly team-wide strategic meetings, handle IT tools that the team uses and most recently stepped in to support TIN to build out SalesForce CRM and migrating 4 work stream's member databases from Airtable to SalesForce.

Within the Impact team, I ensure other work streams provide timely and accurate information for our monitoring and evaluation work, design surveys and analyze the responses for the program teamâ€™s strategy, create research instruments, and periodically review our theory of change, logic model, and its indicators.

In Venture Development, I source, support, and scale holistic innovative and inclusive solutions to combat plastic waste pollution in South and Southeast Asia by designing and running regional and global capacity building programs for ventures and SMEs. I connected with, and brought on over 20 mentors and guides for our programs and facilitated multiple cohort convenings and peer support activities.", 'title': 'Senior Associate, Operations and Impact Management | The Incubation Network', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Singapore', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'SecondMuse', 'description': 'â€¢ Set up the programâ€™s branding, website and social media strategy

We developed the first-ever pilot readiness framework & cohort pilot readiness program and we created an active global community around plastics data with 27 Mentors & Local Advisors from 11 countries, 20+ design-support partners, 30+ Private Sector Partners, 23 Advisory Council Members, 92+ Innovators from 39 Countries, 15+ NGOs, Government and University Partners

â€¢ Part of the founding Culture/DEI working group where we advocate and run workshops and activities for diversity, equity and inclusion while building a better working environment and supporting healthy relationships for the TIN team


ABOUT THE PROGRAM:
The Incubation Network exists to coordinate and accelerate efforts to reduce ocean plastic pollution and increase circularity. The network brings together incubators and accelerators, entrepreneurs and innovators, investors, NGOs, and government leaders from across South and Southeast Asia to develop and scale solutions. This is achieved through programs and partnerships that highlight opportunities forâ€”and demonstrate the potential ofâ€”inclusive, innovative waste management solutions.

volunteer_experiences:
[{'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'role': 'Builder', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'All Hands and Hearts', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQFxpsqHOkoFJg/company-logo_400_400/0/1625233856120?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=f2yOHWuRu9C9htXPdllvDpHa2klDhDgrXE6rC4Umvhg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/all-hands-and-hearts/'}, 'cause': 'HUMANITARIAN_RELIEF', 'description': 'I volunteered in Nepal and raised $1,000 to help the community of Sindhuli with All Hands and Hearts Smart Response. Specifically, I helped to rebuild 1/3 schools in Banjhe, Kamalamai-12, in the Sindhuli District. We worked 6 days a week to get the schools done before the monsoon season hit in May.

Shree Ma Vi School:

The school serves ECS through grade 10 with 190 children enrolled, and 11 staff. Before the 2015 earthquakes, Shree Ma Vi School had 14 classrooms including one office room, a lab room, plus bathroom with 2 toilet pans and 2 urinals, however the majority of the buildings were severely damaged. All Hands and Hearts built one 2-story, four room government design building, repaired the JICA design building and 3 pansanitation system. Additionally, they have implemented a water filtration system to ensure the school community has a reliable source of safe drinking water.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'role': 'Volunteer - Physical Outreach Programs', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Project X Singapore', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQGDOddJxK5f9g/company-logo_400_400/0/1663227552976?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=FSj1I6lNEXmPT2WdMzAKeUh9hCFOcnTjw_APIWLK9T0', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/projectxsg/'}, 'cause': 'CIVIL_RIGHTS', 'description': None}, {'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Volunteer', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Emancipasia', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'HUMAN_RIGHTS', 'description': 'EmancipAsia aims to raise public awareness of human trafficking and modern-day slavery in the Asia Pacific region, to advocate change and to empower communities and individuals to take action to help to combat this horrific crime against humanity. EmancipAsia uses different platforms and channels to reach out to different target audiences and interest groups.

Programmes and activities include a roving photography exhibition, monthly film forum, talks, symposium with NUS, UNLOCK, an experiential learning activity, FETE (dinner with a social objective), a forum theatre piece titled MINUS, a fun run â€˜STEPS in the Parkâ€™ and research.
